Fields

Simple Field Circular Reference (A->B->C->A)

This will demonstrate circular logic based solely on 'own' logic.   Logic that is directly related to the field.

Not in this example but in life.  A field can have 'own' logic and 'parent' logic.  Also, sections are considered fields so they too have 'own' and 'parent', but there parent is always null/empty logic

[A] A->B->C->A (fields)
[B] A->B->C->A (fields)
[C] A->B->C->A (fields)

[A] A->B->C->A (Sections)

The three sections will demonstrate circular logic bases solely on 'parent' logic.  Because a section can not be used in a logic statement but it's visibility determines the visibility of its fields (which can be used in log), each section depends on a field.  The circular reference will because by section visibility.

[A] A->B->C->A (Section/field)

[B] A->B->C->A (Sections)

The three sections will demonstrate circular logic bases solely on 'parent' logic.  Because a section can not be used in a logic statement but it's visibility determines the visibility of its fields (which can be used in log), each section depends on a field.  The circular reference will because by section visibility.

[B] A->B->C->A (Sections/field)

[C] A->B->C->A (Sections)

The three sections will demonstrate circular logic bases solely on 'parent' logic.  Because a section can not be used in a logic statement but it's visibility determines the visibility of its fields (which can be used in log), each section depends on a field.  The circular reference will because by section visibility.

[C] A->B->C->A (Section/feild)
